page.text:
Materials - Common Terrestrial Edition A Guide to Material Properties
By Ayumu Nagasawa

This book contains statistics and information on common materials known to Homeworld. It is essentially an updated version of the now dated Materials and You, Vol 2 written by Skyla.
This work is not to be considered complete. In addition to strange and alien metals found on our new planet, there are plenty of rare terrestrial materials not covered in this book. For info on those, please consult my upcoming, future editions of "Materials"

page.title: Material Traits
page.text:
Some materials have traits that augment their natural uses.
- Reinforced: 10% chance per level of not using durability - Stonebound: The tool mines faster as it wears out, but does less damage - Jagged: The tool attacks with does more damage as it wears out, but mines slower - Writable: One extra modifier per piece - Tasty: Sometimes drops food items

page.title: Material Statistics:
page.text:
Materials have more possible attributes than when Skyla wrote his seminal work.
- Durability: How many times the material can be used before breaking. - Mining Speed: How quickly the tool mines materials it is effective against. - Harvest level: The maximum hardness a tool can mine. - Attack Damage: How much extra damage this tool does when attacking - XP Required: How much XP this material requires to level up. - XP Required: How much XP this material requires to level up. - Tasty: Sometimes drops food items

page.title: Wood
page.text: It seems to grow everywhere.

page.title: Stone
page.text: One of the most common materials in the world.

page.title: Iron
page.text: A staple for tools, it can be refined and processed. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Flint
page.text: More durable than stone. The material of choice for cavemen.

page.title: Cactus
page.text: A form of wood found only in the desert.

page.title: Bone
page.text: A material with many uses, dead or alive.

page.title: Obsidian
page.text: Tough as nails, but fragile when shaped.

page.title: Alumite
page.text: An uncommon alloy. It seems to be quite durable. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Netherrack
page.text: This is made of what?!

page.title: Blue Slime
page.text: Converting it from food has made it stronger.

page.title: Green Slime
page.text: Soft and springy, it seems to last forever.
Slimy Mud

page.title: Paper
page.text: It's very weak, but can take a lot of modification.
Paper Stack

page.title: Cobalt
page.text: One of the nether materials. It's bright blue. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Ardite
page.text: One of the nether materials. It seems to mine faster as it wears out. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Manyullyn
page.text: The nether alloy. It's stronger than diamond. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Copper
page.text: A common metal found in the ground. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Bronze
page.text: A common alloy. It's a bit better than iron. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Steel
page.text: An Iron alloy. The method for obtaining this is unknown. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Pig Iron
page.text: An Iron alloy. It seems to be made of blood, iron, and emeralds. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Diamond
page.text:
Adding a diamond to the edge of a tool seems to make it more resilient.
Effects: - 500 extra durability - Mining level increased to level 3
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Emerald
page.text:
Affixing an emerald to a tool's weakest point appears to make it more resilient.
Effects: - 50% more durability - Mining level increased to level 2
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Speed
page.text:
Adding redstone to a tool seems to increase its mining speed.
Effects: - Each redstone dust increases mining speed by 0.08. - At 50/50 the boost is 4.0, making a wood pickaxe equivalent in speed to iron. - Not useful on weapons
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Auto-Repair
page.text:
Attaching moss to a tool infuses it with life. The tool appears to be capable of regenerating wear and tear.
Effects: - The tool slowly repairs itself - Sunlight speeds up the process
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Auto-Smelt
page.text:
Melting a lava crystal onto the end of a tool gives it the power of a furnace.
Effects: - Smelts blocks as they're harvested - Sets mobs on fire for 3 seconds - Stacks with Luck - Not compatible with Silky
Type: Multi-use Stackable: No
Ball of Moss
Lava Crystal

page.title: Luck
page.text:
Encrusting lapis on tools is a gift to the gods of luck. They will bless your tool with great fortune and loot.
Effects: - Adds fortune or looting, depends on tool type - Increases level at a maximum threshold, but has a chance of increasing before - Sometimes adds extra luck to the tool - Not compatible with Silky
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Sharpness
page.text:
Adding quartz to the edge of a tool seems to make it sharper.
Effects: - Increases attack damage - Has less of an effect on tools with piercing properties
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Fiery
page.text:
Adding blaze powder to a tool gives it a fiery tinge.
Effects: - Sets enemies on fire - Every 5 powder adds another second to the flame.
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Necrotic
page.text:
Placing the bone of a Wither Skelton on a tool gives it nefarious life-stealing powers.
Effects: - Heals the player every time a monster is attacked - Heals one heart per bone
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Silky
page.text:
Adding a large glob of alunimum brass or gold and a bunch of string seems to give the tool silky-smooth properties.
Effects: - Allows blocks to be harvested directly - Scythes modified with Silky act as shears on blocks - Not compatible with Luck or Auto-Smelt
Type: Single-use Stackable: No
Silky Cloth
Silky Jewel

page.title: Reinforced
page.text:
Adding an obsidian plate to the tool seems to help with its durability.
Effects: - Adds the material trait Reinforced to the tool - Stacks with previous levels of Reinforced
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Knockback
page.text:
Attaching a piston to the tool and activating it at the right time seems to throw mobs further away.
Effects: - Adds extra knockback to the tool.
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Beheading
page.text:
Working an ender pearl and some obsidian on a weapon has the curious effect of separating the target's head from its body.
Effects: - Beheads mobs. Enemies drop their heads as a result.
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Bane of Arthropods
page.text:
Striking a spider with its own eyeball causes it to recoil in fear.
Effects: - Does extra damage to spiders. - 1-2 hearts per level.
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Smite
page.text:
The raw power of consecrated soil empowers your weapon, smiting enemies from on high.
Effects: - Does extra damage to undead. - 1-2 hearts per level.
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes
Graveyard Soil
Consecrated Soil

page.title: Flux
page.text:
Adding a Hardened Flux Capacitor or Leadstone Energy Cell gives a tool energy. The tool still functions properly when the Cell/Capacitor has no charge.
Effects: - Allows the tool to be charged with Redstone Flux - Uses energy instead of durability while charged - Available from Thermal Expansion
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Additional Modifiers
page.text:
Working the tool with a block of gold and a diamond makes the tool more malleable, allowing for more modification.
Effects: - Adds an additional modifier slot to the tool
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Additional Modifiers
page.text:
Attaching a solid gold apple and encrusting the tool with a block of diamond warps the tool in places you did not notice before.
Effects: - Adds an additional modifier slot to the tool
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Additional Modifiers
page.text:
Working the tool with a nether star gives it the ability to attach parts they would not otherwise stay.
Effects: - Adds an additional modifier slot to the tool
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Additional Modifiers
page.text:
For the creative types or the map makers in the world, this item is for you.
Effects: - Adds an additional modifier slot to the tool - If it has a target lock, it will only work on that tool.
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes
